codeReview.summary: Implementation meets the feature intent: fromFetch(response) returns Ok for 2xx, maps required HTTP statuses to the expected error categories, is exported from @outfitter/contracts, and includes tests plus a minor changeset.

issues.description: HTTP status-to-category mapping is re-declared locally instead of deriving from the canonical taxonomy mapping in errors.ts (statusCodeMap). Behavior is correct now, but this introduces drift risk if taxonomy mappings evolve.

sharedStateObservations.observation: The library-worker export verification procedure assumes root-level workspace imports (`@outfitter/<pkg>`), but this failed in the reviewed run; the worker had to switch to package-local dist import. Skill guidance should include this fallback to avoid repeated false negatives.

The user-testing library guidance repeats the same root-level import verification pattern that failed during this feature run, so local verification guidance is potentially misleading for this monorepo setup.
sharedStateObservations.evidence: .factory/library/user-testing.md:42; worker transcript skeleton (session b83e2e01-4039-44ec-8af2-638223234dfb) lines 388 and 413

sharedStateObservations.observation: library-worker contains conflicting verification guidance: one section says not to use `bun run check` due known crash, but the example handoff still lists `bun run check`.

summary: Review result: pass. Feature implementation is functionally complete for OS-334 with one non-blocking maintainability concern and shared-state documentation/skill gaps captured for triage.
